docs.snippet: Opinion polls published on Sunday in the United States and Germany cast doubt over the level of trust people have in Facebook over privacy, as the firm ran advertisements in British and U.S. newspapers apologizing to users.

headline.print_headline: Americans Less Likely to Trust Facebook Than Rivals on Personal Data
headline.main: Americans Less Likely to Trust Facebook Than Rivals on Personal Data

docs.snippet: Remington Outdoor Co Inc [FREDM.UL], one of the largest U.S. makers of firearms, filed for bankruptcy protection on Sunday to carry out a debt-cutting deal with creditors amid mounting public pressure for greater gun control.

Facebook is expanding its response to people using the platform improperly and on Tuesday said it had deleted hundreds of Russian accounts and pages associated with a "troll factory" indicted by U.S. prosecutors for fake activist and political pos...

headline.print_headline: Facebook Deletes Posts Linked to Russian 'Troll Factory': CEO Zuckerberg
headline.main: Facebook Deletes Posts Linked to Russian 'Troll Factory': CEO Zuckerberg

docs.snippet: Sacramento Kings and Boston Celtics players, in a protest backed by the National Basketball Association, took to the court on Sunday wearing warm-up T-shirts emblazoned with the name of the unarmed black man slain last week by Sacramento police.

headline.print_headline: NBA's Kings and Celtics Protest Police Shootings of Unarmed Black Men
headline.main: NBA's Kings and Celtics Protest Police Shootings of Unarmed Black Men

headline.print_headline: UNICEF Calls on Yemen's Warring Sides to Stop Impeding Aid
headline.main: UNICEF Calls on Yemen's Warring Sides to Stop Impeding Aid

docs.snippet: The case, amid a reinvigorated debate over guns, has been closely watched as it tries to pierce the legal shield protecting gun companies from lawsuits.

headline.print_headline: Gun Maker’s Bankruptcy Stalls a Lawsuit Brought by Newtown Families
